paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 rs144848 polymorphism, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: various ethnicities including Caucasian, Asian, and African
patients.phenotype: cancer risk, specifically associated with non-Hodgkin lymphoma and breast cancer

functional_data.summary: The rs144848 polymorphism may affect BRCA2 structure and function, potentially influencing cancer susceptibility.

variants.segregation_data: Not explicitly mentioned in the paper.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate, based on meta-analysis of multiple studies.
variants.additional_notes: The rs144848 polymorphism was not associated with breast cancer or ovarian cancer in any model, but was associated with non-Hodgkin lymphoma.
key_quotes: The rs144848 polymorphism was associated with non-Hodgkin lymphoma in four models.
The rs144848 H allele of the BRCA2 gene may be a low-penetrate risk factor enhancing carcinogenesis in breast cancer.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the BRCA2 rs144848 polymorphism.
